title: Why can't we play music for both parties to hear on an Android phone while on call? - Quora

response.answer_text: You would then be broadcasting from one device to others directly. That is a big no no unless you have the licenses and permits to do so. You could put the music on in the background like from a computer or even an iPod, smartphone, portable radio, or whatever it may be and you two could listen in while talking. The microphone is designed to pick up your voice and any background audio in the area. The device isn't designed to also put in other audio inputs live when the microphone is being used and broadcast it together.

During a call, the other party listens to your voice through the microphone. When the music is played through the phone, due to Android limitations, the sound output cannot be recorded or shared directly. The music can be shared only through your microphone input.
